title: Great Stay! Fantastic!
text: Intercontinental Athenaeum is one of the best hotels I have stayed in Europe! The rooms are very spacious and provide great value for their price. A family suite provides a fair cost for more than 500 square feet of spacious accommodation for 5 people. Clean rooms block out noise and provide high sleep quality, which is of the utmost importance for one's stay! Breakfast is absolutely amazing and includes a wide spread of different breads, pastries, vegetables, fruits, yogurt, cold cuts, etc.. I found the fresh waffles made on request to be quite delicious. The staff at this hotel are very friendly and accommodating towards requests, and quick to help; the hotel manager and front-desk are additionally very warm and welcoming. The service is fantastic!! I could not find any fault with it. There was no problem with the location. Although several others had commented on the proximity of a worn-down neighborhood to the hotel, my family felt very safe during the entirety of our recent 1-week stay at this hotel! The front lobby is exceedingly spacious and provides great space to relax. If you're hungry, both the Art Bistrot and Premiere restaurant (which provides amazing dinner and views of the Acropolis, although somewhat pricey) are feasible options for your meals. This hotel deserves its 5-star rating! Must-stay in Athens!

title: Come see this amazing building in Athens!
text: The Parthenon is the most famous building in Athens, and one of the most important structures in Europe. A must-see in Athens!

title: The most important icon to see in Athens!
text: The Parthenon is beautiful! The walk, which is not too long, offers a stunning view of the Parthenon along the way.

title: Delicious Souvlaki! A charming place in the heart of Athens!
text: Located near the Acropolis, this little gem has amazing Souvlaki and authentic Greek dishes. The oven-roasted lamb is incredible. Service is at its best: efficient, warm, and welcoming!

title: The best small carrier I have ever flown in!
text:
Aegean/Olympic Air operated my flight between Athens and Santorini and the return. The outbound to Santorini consisted of a very quick and efficient boarding procedure conducted by Aegean Airlines. The crew passed out aroma-therapeutic orange candies before takeoff. I cannot comment on the full service, as due to turbulence, the full service was not carried out; however, the crew passed out little ginger cookies as we left the aircraft.
The sole purpose of this review is to underscore the efficiency and care taken by Aegean to compensate my family and me for the cancellation of our return flight to Athens from Santorini due to extremely bad weather. The cancellation of the flight and provisions afterward prove that Aegean is concerned about the safety of their passengers and willing to take care of their passengers' needs. After Aegean canceled our Olympic Air flight, they instructed us to proceed to one of the two Aegean ticketing counters. Upon arrival, an agent swiftly printed out a new boarding pass to replace our previous one, placing our return flight the next day, and asked us if we had any concerns. Having decided on a day trip to Santorini, we did not have a place to stay. Aegean booked us into a FIVE-STAR hotel for the night and included breakfast and dinner as well. They even covered transportation both ways between the hotel and the airport! Aegean took the time to make sure their customers were safe and provided a place to stay for not only me and my family but also all other passengers on my cancelled flight. I haven't seen any other airlines do this, especially for weather-related cancellations. The return flight, although extremely turbulent, departed on time, and it was skillfully handled by the crew and experienced pilots who successfully navigated the turboprop through extremely heavy cloud cover and moderate winds. Way to go, Aegean! Keep up the great work!

title: Fantastic food! Must visit in Cologne!
text: Delicious food! Every single dish was prepared well with lots of flavour, spice, and variety. Spring rolls were very tasty. Meat dishes and rice were good as well. I am very happy that this is one of the most hygienic restaurants I've ever been to! This restaurant also has extremely attentive and cordial service. Must visit in Cologne!

title: Good Food, Location nice and spacious
text: Nice and spacious restaurant. Ordered a bunch of dishes, including rice, chicken, and beef. Clean in general but only issue was that most of the dishes were sweet.

title: Excellent Food! Great Restaurant!
text: Excellent Food! Awesome kebabs, appetizers(falafel, rice, pita) and dessert. Waiters were super friendly and kept plying us with more and more bread and drinks. Location is very good, restaurant is nicely sized and cozy(not big). I enjoyed my visit. Thanks so much!

title: Nice property and location
text: Nice property! Location is also amazing... located near the Carlyle Condominiums. Very big hotel. Nice and spacious rooms. Convenient 3 floor parking garage with direct access to the rooms via elevator. Amazing!
place: Residence Inn by Marriott Alexandria Old Town South at Carlyle

title: Good location! Nice rooms!
text: Very nice location. Located in the middle of waterfront harbor and close to many good restaurants such as Grace's Mandarin and restaurants in the Gaylord Convention Center. Very big rooms! 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, nice hall/living room and family room.

title: Excellent food
text: Been to this restaurant 2 times. Ordered their starter, the spring rolls. Filling was delicious and so was the sauce that accompanied it. Waiter was super friendly and assisted us with our order. Hot towels before service. Amazing! For the main, we had the pad thai noodles, which were delicious, the chengdu chicken and the pepper steak. Restuarant is one of the biggest restaurants I've ever seen, with 3 floors. Top 2 are for children, while bottom is for adults only(bar and dance area). Beautiful on a rainy day.

title: The food was delicious!
text:
The food was absolutely delicious. A must-visit for hungry travelers in Fresno.
Recommendations:
-The lunch platter is well-priced and the restaurants is generally full, so try to reserve a table. The spicy lamb and the orange chicken are must-trys.
-For the appetizer plate, you get fried chicken and a spring roll, accompanied by a peanut-sauce salad which is delicious.
-You can choose Egg-Drop or Hot and Sour for the soup.
Server was extremely friendly and efficient. Restaurant is impeccably clean!

title: Delicious.
text:
Delicious food. Friendly server. Only problem was that the food is extremely spicy.
but you can get a good meal for a decent price.

title: Good Hotel!
text: Very good hotel. One of the best hotels in Fresno. Rooms are incredibly spacious and the hotel is big. Breakfast is delicious. Only problem is that some staff are unfriendly. Otherwise, one of the better Hilton Hotels.
place: DoubleTree by Hilton Fresno Convention Center

title: Excellent Buffet, food was delicious
text: Went there for Christmas Day dinner buffet. Food was delicious. There was a large variety of curries, noodles, rice, paneer, fried appetizers, and breads. My favorite part of the buffet was the dessert. There were so many desserts to choose from, among them being plum pudding, mango soft-serve ice cream(ABSOLUTELY delish), warm bread pudding, and delicious cake, gulab jamun, and rasmalai. So much variety and delicious food! I will be visiting again.

title: Food was ok, value was extremely disappointing.
text: Cascal was one of many options that we had for our celebration. Cascal won, so we went there for dinner. The place was extremely crowded, but thanks to the nice atmosphere, large entry area, and efficient staff, we were seated almost immediately. For the appetizer, we ordered the pomegranate meatballs and the wild mushroom empanadas. Those were delicious. Next, we ordered the paella, which was extremely disappointing, as it lacked moisture and had very little meat. We also ordered more delicious warm bread and some other snacks. For dessert, my wife ordered a warm chocolate souffle and I ordered the flan. The souffle was sticky and warm, but the flan was opposite in quality. It was extremely dry and oversweet. I would recommend everybody to definitely try out this restaurant but you would have to order the right dishes.

title: Nice Hotel
text: I really liked the hotel. Stay was elegant, beautiful view of the marina and the pier, I could see the city all the way from my room. A lot of dining options nearby. Very centralized locale and popular destination.

title: Nice hotel, location is not good
text: Very nice hotel. Staff are very friendly and food is good. My room was also extremely clean and spacious. Unfortunately, the location is not very good. It is pretty much "hidden" from the rest of the city, and there was a very long road to get there.
place: Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott Lethbridge

title: Tasty food! Great restaurant
text: Delicious food. Extremely fast service and great quantities. Great for those who are in desperate need of food, especially travelers and tourists. Tasty!

title: Close to the airport, good deal
text: I highly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Great breakfast. Spacious rooms. However, staff are a little disorganized and the room itself is kind of confusing. On the positive side, the room is ultra-modern.

title: Ok food, Fast service
text: The food here is ok. Butter chicken was not great, as it was chewy and hard. The naan bread and roti were delicious. However, their cheap buffet only consisted of 4 dishes. I would recommend the a la carte.

title: Great stay
text: Good stay, breakfast is expensive at 35 CHF. I recommend the rooms, they are great, but are small for groups of 3 or four. Somehow, I still found that this trip was completely satisfied, as the room was a good value for the money.

title: Excellent
text: I have no comment except that there is no breakfast in the hotel! But this is no reason to complain: there are plenty of Tim Horton's and A&W breakfast restaurants in the area where you can grab a satiating bite.
place: Solara Resort & Spa - Bellstar Hotels & Resorts

title: Spice levels!! Tone them down
text: Food quality was ok, butter chicken was liquidy, lamb rogan josh was over the top spicy. I had no complaints of service but rather of the food quality. Hygiene was good.

title: HELLO?!?!?!?! NO SECURITY CAMERAS
text:
There were no security cameras?!!??!?! Somebody robbed my family's car... and took EVERYTHING. All thanks to you. I can sue you in court for this mishap.
Please take some action. Explain to me why this happened.

title: Worth the visit
text: This is highly recommended for those who want to try Thai food in the area! Had delicious chicken, duck, beef and lamb options, delicious Tom Kim soup, and excellent deep fried coconut ice cream! Lovely dinner!

title: The place was nice
text: Atmosphere nice, main courses very good, only the hot and sour soup was a bit too spicy for my taste.

title: Exciting
text: Visit highly interesting! A must visit! One of the highlights of my trip was the Rodin Sculptures! Those were beautiful!

title: Average......
text:
Stayed at this hotel on vacation to Europe. Room was okay, didn't have a lot of amenities....

The food for breakfast was horrible!

Something funny was that I stayed at the Crowne Plaza- The City in London, and it had BETTER Croissants and pastries than this hotel!

Isn't Paris supposed to have the best pastries in the world?!?!?!?!?!

title: Very beautiful....
text: The Luxembourg Gardens are a must see when visiting Paris, just as Trafalgar Square is in London, UK.

title: I LOVED It!
text: I LOVED the fountains, great place for your kids if they want to hang out around the pigeons and have fun!

title: Dissapointing.....
text:
Line outside the palace was poorly managed and was SUPER Long!!!!! Had to wait for about an hour, even though I had SKIP THE LINE TICKETS!!!!!!

In the palace, we discovered that we had actually been cheated! The only thing inside that was nice was the statues. Everything else was dissapointing. It looked like the place had been ransacked!

title: Good Food!
text: The Meal that i ordered was tasty. had the Sweet and sour spare ribs, dim sum, and the imperial chicken with rice(at least i thought that was what it was called, anyway the food was tasty). The only thing was that the quantity was small.

title: The Louvre was definitely worth my time
text:
The Louvre is a huge museum with stores and a lot of attractions!

All the attractions are SPECTACULAR! The Louvre is also air-conditioned.

You should also buy something from a chocolate store in the Louvre called Le Maison Du Chocolat! The chocolates and macaroons are absolutely spectacular!!!!!!!!!

title: BEAUTIFUL!!!!!!!
text:
The tower is absolutely stunning and beautiful at nighttime when it is lit up!

The view from the tower is also beautiful. Definitely a must visit when in Paris!

title: Excellent Views!!!!!
text:
The views are just A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!!!!!!!!
Nothing to beat those views!

There is a great view of the whole city of Paris including the Eiffel Tower!!!!!!!!!
